body.name: Glorto GeForce GT 610 2G DDR3 Low Profile Graphics Card, PCI Express 1.1 x16, HDMI/VGA, Entry Level GPU for PC, SFF and HTPC
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 1 hr 28 mins
features: Powered by NVIDIA GeForce GT 610, 40nm chipset process with 523MHz core frequency
Integrated with 2048MB DDR3 memory and 64-bit bus width
HDMI / VGA 2 ports output available. HDMI Max Resolution-2560x1600, VGA Max Resolution-2048x1536
Original half height bracket matches with the low profile brackets make the Glorto GeForce GT 610 graphics card fit well with all PC tower, small form factor and HTPC(except micro form factor)
body.description: NVIDIA GeForce GT 610 2GB DDR3 64 Bit PCI Express 1.1 x 16 Low Profile Video Card Low noise and silent work, lower temperature and higher efficiency With 2048MB of memory capacity, this graphics card can meet the demands of home entertainment, light gaming, and office tasks. Offers VGA and HDMI interfaces, making the video card easy to connect different types of displays. The VGA interface is suitable for analog signals and the HDMI interface supports high-definition video transmission.Features a half-height low-profile design that making it compatible with various computer cases, especially SFF tower match with the included brackets.

productInformation.value: 5.0 5.0 out of 5 stars 2 ratings 5.0 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Glorto GeForce GT 610 2G graphics card, a powerful and affordable solution for improving your old computer experience. Designed with NVIDIA's upgraded generation of GPU technology, the GT 610 delivers high-performance graphics processing capabilities while maintaining optimal energy efficiency. With a memory capacity of 2GB, the GT 610 can handle even the most graphically demanding applications and games with ease. Its fast memory speed ensures smooth animations and seamless gameplay, while the large memory capacity allows for better multitasking and improved overall system performance. The GT 610 is optimized for maximum compatibility with many kinds of operating systems, ensuring smooth integration into your existing system. It supports DirectX 11 for advanced graphics rendering and comes with Nvidia's official drivers for stable performance and enhanced features. The card's low profile design makes it ideal for small form factor systems or any other space-conscious build, while its cooling system ensures quiet operation and increased reliability. Whether you're a casual gamer, a graphics professional, or someone looking to enhance the overall performance of their old PC, the GT 610 2G graphics card offers a perfect balance of performance and affordability.

NVIDIA GeForce GT 610 2GB DDR3 64 Bit PCI Express 1.1 x 16 Low Profile Video Card Low noise and silent work, lower temperature and higher efficiency With 2048MB of memory capacity, this graphics card can meet the demands of home entertainment, light gaming, and office tasks. Offers VGA and HDMI interfaces, making the video card easy to connect different types of displays. The VGA interface is suitable for analog signals and the HDMI interface supports high-definition video transmission.Features a half-height low-profile design that making it compatible with various computer cases, especially SFF tower match with the included brackets. What You Will Get: Glorto GeForce GT 610 2GB Graphics Card x1 Low Profile Bracket x1
What Glorto GeForce GT 610 Can Do: Dual Screen Display Picture & Video Editing Office Working

Specification GPU Name GF119 Memory Format 2GB DDR3 64 bits Ports HDMI / VGA CUDA Core 48 GPU Clock 523 MHz Memory Clock 500 MHz Shader Clock 1046 MHz Slot PCI Express x16 1.1 DirectX Support DirectX 11.0 Maximum Digital Resolution 2560x1600 Computing OpenCL / CUDA / DirectCompute 5.0 Technologies OpenGL

Troubleshooting Tips The following troubleshooting tips may help if you experience problems. Contact GLORTO for more advanced troubleshooting information. Check that the card is seated properly in the PCI Express slot.Ensure that the display cable is securely fastened to the card's display connector.Make sure that the monitor and computer are plugged in and receiving power.If necessary, disable any built-in graphics capabilities on your motherboard. For more information, consult your computer's manual or manufacturer. (NOTE: Some manufacturers do not allow the built-in graphics to be disabled or to become the secondary display.)Make sure you selected the appropriate display device and graphics card when you install the graphics driver.Restart your computer. Press on your keyboard after system starts up. When the Windows Advanced Options Menu appears, select Safe Mode and press . After getting into Safe Mode, in Device Manager check whether the driver for the graphics card is correct.If you are not able to find the desired monitor color/resolution settings: The color and screen resolution options available for selection depend on the graphics card being installed. If necessary, adjust your monitor's setting using monitor's adjust panel to make the screen look focused, crisp, and sharp. (Please refer to the monitor's manual.)

reviews.reviewText: It pumped new life into my older desktop!
